author: Daniel Flatley
description: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said he would continue his campaign to reduce financial regulations, highlighting the Trump administration’s effort to bolster economic security amid concerns over persistent inflation and affordability.
title: Bessent Emphasizes Economic Growth in Bid to Ease Regulation

author: Eric Martin
description: The seizure of an enormous oil supertanker off the coast of Venezuela on Wednesday is just the beginning of a new phase in the Trump administration’s ramped-up pressure campaign against Nicolas Maduro, according to people familiar with the operation.
title: Tanker Seizure Just the Start as Trump Ups Pressure on Venezuela

author: Kyle Kim, Stephanie Davidson, Sana Pashankar, Becca Wasser
description: President Donald Trump’s proposed missile and air defense system, meant to swat down threats from near ground level all the way into space, is an enormous task — and comes with a huge price tag.
title: Golden Dome: The Astronomical Cost of Defeating ‘Any Foreign Aerial Attack’

author: Myles Miller
description: Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem was pressed by House Democrats on Thursday over theTrump administration’s broadened deportation campaign, sparking boos from protesters and calls for her resignation.
title: Noem Faces Fury Over Deportations During Fiery House Hearing

author: Nancy Cook
description: White House plans campaign to talk up the president’s economic record.
title: Trump Still Wrestling With How to Deal With Affordability Issue

author: Jen Judson
description: Two US companies have partnered to develop magnets for sensitive systems such as guided munitions, the latest sign of the defense industry’s effort to break free of dependence on rare-earth minerals from China.
title: US’s Niron, Moog Team to Lessen Reliance on Chinese Rare Earths

description: Mexico will put tariffs on Chinese imports of up to 50%. This new policy aligns with US efforts to tighten trade barriers with China. The new levies go into effect next year. Gonzalo Soto reports. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Mexico to Put Tariffs of Up to 50% on Chinese Imports

author: Colum Murphy, Lucille Liu
description: When China’s ties with Japan last spiraled over a decade ago, Beijing fueled nationwide boycotts of Japanese brands and even street protests. This time around, President Xi Jinping is taking a more measured approach — for now, at least.
title: China Keeps Buying Sushi, Japan’s Cars as Xi Keeps Spat in Check

author: Jim Wyss
description: Cuba will begin allowing transactions in dollars and other foreign currencies as it tries to stabilize an economy that’s been crushed by US sanctions, sweeping power outages and decades of mismanagement.
title: Cuba Opens Doors to Dollar Transactions as Its Economy Stumbles

author: Jennifer A Dlouhy, Leah Nylen
description: Hollywood has a rich history of personal vendettas, political discord and uncertain loyalties shaping the industry.
title: Trump’s Warner Bros. Meddling Pushes Limits of Executive Power

description: On today's episode of Bloomberg Businessweek Daily, Carol Massar and Tim Stenovec discuss Oracle shares plunging after increasing its spending on AI. Bloomberg's Robert Schiffman joins the show to break it down. Also on today's show, Bloomberg's Michael McKee and AlphaSimplex Group Portfolio Manager Katy Kaminski discuss this week's Federal Reserve decision, including how 'silent dissents' reveal growing resistance to Fed Chair Powell's rate cuts, and Bloomberg's Hannah Miller talks Disney investing $1 billion in OpenAI after striking a licensing deal. Plus, New York Life Investments Economist & Chief Market Strategist Lauren Goodwin discusses the market's reaction to the Fed decision and how inflation could impact the Fed in 2026. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Escalating AI Spend Sends Oracle Plummeting | Bloomberg Businessweek Daily 12/11/2025

description: Following Wednesday's decision by the Fed to lower interest rates once again, New York life Investments Chief Market Strategist Lauren Goodwin believes that rates falling into the lower bound of neutral will spur the markets to say 'no more,' forcing the 10-year yield to move higher. She joined Carol Massar and Tim Stenovec on 'Bloomberg Businessweek Daily' to discuss the market's reaction to the Fed decision and how inflation could impact the Fed in 2026. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Markets Could Say 'No More' to Fed Cuts, Says New York Life Investment's Goodwin

author: Ari Natter
description: The House voted Thursday to curb states’ authority to block pipelines, part of a renewed Republican push to overhaul the federal permitting process for energy and other major projects.
title: House Votes to Limit States’ Power to Block Pipelines

description: Bloomberg's Hannah Miller says that Disney made a 'huge statement' by aligning the company with OpenAI and allowing its suite of iconic characters to be used in AI created videos.  Miller says that the deal show that no one in Hollywood wants to be left behind in the AI race.  (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Disney Invests $1 Billion in OpenAI, Strikes Licensing Deal

description: On the early edition of Balance of Power, Bloomberg Washington Correspondent Joe Mathieu discusses the latest from Capitol Hill. On today's show, Democratic Congressman Brendan Boyle, Republican Congressman Nicole Malliotakis, Stonecourt Capital Partner Rick Davis and Harvard Kennedy School's Ash Center Visiting Democracy Fellow Jeanne Sheehan Zaino. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Senate Rejects Obamacare Credit Renewal | Balance of Power: Early Edition 12/11/2025

description: Oracle Corp. shares plunged after the company escalated its spending on AI data centers and other equipment, erasing more than $100 billion in market value. The latest earning report and share slide marks a reversal of fortunes for a company that just a few months ago was enjoying a blistering rally and clinching multibillion-dollar data center deals. Bloomberg's Robert Schiffman joined Carol Massar and Tim Stenovec on 'Bloomberg Businessweek Daily' to break it down. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Oracle Slides on AI Spending, Erases More than $100B in Market Value

author: Josh Sisco, Leah Nylen
description: The US Federal Trade Commission is preparing a lawsuit to challenge an acquisition by Henkel AG of part of Pittsburgh Paint Co., which is owned by private equity firm American Industrial Partners, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: FTC Weighs Antitrust Challenge of Henkel Bid for Adhesive Maker

description: New York Republican Representative Nicole Malliotakis said a bipartisan compromise plan in the House would extend Obamacare subsidies with protections against fraud but its unclear whether it will get a vote. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Malliotakis Says ACA Plan With Fraud Protections Popular, But May Not Get Floor Vote

author: Caitlin Reilly
description: The Treasury Department is preparing to release a corporate tax workaround that would deliver large tax savings to companies including Salesforce Inc. and Qualcomm Inc.
title: Trump Administration Plans to Boost Tax Break for Corporations

author: Hadriana Lowenkron
description: President Donald Trump is getting more frustrated with Ukraine and Russia over delays negotiating a ceasefire deal, his spokeswoman said, adding to pressure on officials in Kyiv who pushed back on an earlier US proposal seen as too accommodating to Moscow.
title: Trump ‘Extremely Frustrated’ Over Ukraine Delays, Leavitt Says

author: Nicola M White
description: Foreign corporate insiders would have to reveal when they buy or sell company stock under a provision included under the House-passed defense authorization bill, a move backers describe as closing a loophole that hurts US investors.
title: Foreign Insiders Face SEC Stock Trade Disclosures Under Bill

author: Jorge Valero, Mark Schroers, Alessandra Migliaccio, Kamil Kowalcze
description: Euro-area finance ministers formally launched the process to find a successor to European Central Bank Vice President Luis de Guindos, kicking off a two-year revamp of the institution’s Executive Board.
title: Race for ECB’s No. 2 Job Kicked Off by Euro-Area Finance Chiefs

author: Slav Okov
description: Bulgaria faces a fresh wave of political turmoil after street protests over rampant corruption led to the resignation of the prime minister just weeks before the country joins the euro.
title: Bulgaria Faces More Political Turmoil Just as It Adopts the Euro

author: Augusta Saraiva
description: Brazil President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva spoke by phone with Nicolas Maduro for the first time in months last week, O Globo reported, as the embattled Venezuelan leader comes under mounting US pressure to step aside.
title: Lula Spoke to Maduro About US-Venezuela Tensions, Globo Reports

description:
President Zelenskiy has floated a referendum on territorial control in Ukraine's east as part of a peace plan to end the war.

Kyiv is coming under mounting pressure to agree terms, as Alex Morgan explains. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Zelenskiy Floats Referendum on Territory as Part of Peace Deal

description: A Republican plan to replace expiring Obamacare subsidies with federally funded health savings accounts has been rejected by the Senate. The failure of the plan comes before a vote later in the day on a Democratic bill to extend the tax credits that is also expected to fail. Tyler Kendall reports on Bloomberg Television. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Senate Rejects GOP Plan for Health Savings Accounts

author: Caitlin Reilly
description: The Senate rejected a Republican plan to replace expiring Obamacare subsidies with federally funded health savings accounts, teeing up a vote later in the day on a Democratic bill to extend the tax credits that is also expected to fail.
title: Senate Rejects GOP Health Plan as Insurance Premium Spike Looms

description: Greg Abel is taking the reins of Berkshire Hathaway, a $1 trillion conglomerate, and will also be in command of a $382 billion war chest. Abel's ascension to the top role means he will oversee the firm's insurance operations and manage its roughly $280 billion stock portfolio, areas where he lacks a track record. Bloomberg's Alexandre Rajbhandari joins Bloomberg Intelligence to discuss. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Berkshire’s New Top Boss Looks to Make Buffett’s Empire His Own

author: Sotiris Nikas, Jorge Valero, Kamil Kowalcze, Alessandra Migliaccio
description: Greek Finance Minister Kyriakos Pierrakakis won the race to become president of the Eurogroup, clinching one of the euro area’s top economic jobs in a first for the formerly crisis-ridden nation.
title: Eurogroup Gets First Greek Chief in Break From Crisis Past

author: Anthony Halpin
description: Russian President Vladimir Putin spoke with his Venezuelan counterpart, Nicolas Maduro, expressing solidarity amid growing external pressure, according to the Kremlin.
title: Putin Expresses Solidarity With Venezuela in Maduro Call, Kremlin Says

author: Jorge Valero, Alberto Nardelli, Ania Nussbaum
description: France is pushing to delay the conclusion of a free-trade agreement between the European Union and some of the largest South American economies in a move that could derail the deal.
title: France Seeks to Delay Mercosur Accord, Risking Deal’s Collapse

author: Olesia Safronova
description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy floated the prospect of putting the issue of territorial control in the country’s east to a referendum as Kyiv comes under mounting pressure to agree to terms of an emerging peace plan to end Russia’s war.
title: Zelenskiy Floats Referendum Over Territory as US Pressure Mounts

author: Francesca Maglione, Nacha Cattan
description: Columbia University extended its search for a new president as it seeks to find a permanent replacement after losing two leaders in the past 16 months.
title: Harvard Professor, Vanderbilt Chief Exit Columbia’s Top Job Search

author: Patpicha Tanakasempipat
description: Thai Prime Minister Anutin Charnvirakul said he plans to dissolve parliament to pave way for an early election after reports of a key political party backing his minority government moving to withdraw its support.
title: Thai PM Plans to Dissolve Parliament to Pave Way for Early Vote

author: Zoe Tillman
description: A federal judge in Maryland has ordered the release of Kilmar Armando Abrego Garcia, a Salvadoran migrant at the center of political and legal battles for months as a symbol of President Donald Trump’s hardline immigration policies.
title: Abrego Garcia Wins Latest Bid to Be Released From US Custody

author: Helen Nyambura
description: Tanzania’s main opposition party has called for the annulment of October’s presidential vote and the formation of a transitional government to oversee constitutional reforms and fresh elections.
title: Tanzania Opposition Demands Annulment of Presidential Election

author: Hadriana Lowenkron, Shruti Srivastava
description: President Donald Trump spoke with Prime Minister Narendra Modi as negotiators from the US and India work to resolve differences over an elusive trade agreement.
title: Trump, Modi Speak as US-India Trade Talks Inch Forward

author: Kamil Kowalcze, Alessandra Migliaccio, Daniel Basteiro, Lyubov Pronina
description: Germany will back Greek finance chief Kyriakos Pierrakakis to head the monthly meetings of euro-area peers, according to Finance Minister Lars Klingbeil.
title: Germany Says It Will Back Greece to Lead Euro Finance Ministers

author: Slav Okov
description: Bulgarian Prime Minister Rosen Zhelyazkov offered to resign after a wave of protests, deepening political chaos just weeks before the Balkan country joins the euro area.
title: Bulgarian Premier to Resign as Crisis Hits Before Euro Entry

author: Alex Morales
description: The UK government vowed to pass its flagship legislation on employment rights by Christmas, despite suffering a defeat Wednesday in the House of Lords.
title: UK Government Vows to Pass Workers’ Rights Bill by Christmas

author: Daedo Kim
description: South Korea is moving to establish a new sovereign wealth fund modeled after Singapore’s Temasek, aiming to build a platform capable of pursuing strategic and commercially-driven investments.
title: Korea to Create Commercially Driven Temasek-Style Sovereign Fund

author: Zoltan Simon
description: Trailing in the polls, the EU’s longest-serving leader and nationalist firebrand is considering how to stick around.
title: President Orban? Hungary’s Leader Plots Post-Election Future

author: Beril Akman
description: Turkey’s central bank cut interest rates for the fourth time in a row, accelerating the pace of reductions following favorable inflation data.
title: Turkey Steps Up Rate-Cut Pace After Softer Inflation Data

author: Rachel Gamarski, Fernando Travaglini
description: A key member of one of Brazil’s most prominent business groups is holding out hope for a centrist candidate to emerge in next year’s presidential election, criticizing the left and right for failing to address the South American nation’s economic and social challenges.
title: Brazil’s Business Elite Keeps Hope Alive for Centrist Candidate

author: Chloe Meley, Arvelisse Bonilla Ramos
description: While the longest government shutdown in US history is over, the consequences of the 43-day impasse are only just starting to feed through for companies across the US and beyond.
title: Companies Are Just Now Tallying Up the Impact of the US Shutdown

author: Neil Munshi
description: The US president’s claim to have ended eight wars doesn’t stand up to closer scrutiny.
title: Trump’s Nobel Quest Faces a Reality Check

author: Jorge Valero
description: The European Union reached a preliminary agreement to strengthen its screening of foreign direct investments, the latest move meant to help shield the local economy from China and the US.
title: EU Reaches Deal to Heighten Foreign Investment Screening

author: Samuel Stolton
description: Chinese security firm Nuctech has been hit by a full-scale European Union investigation amid concerns subsidies from Beijing gave it an unfair market advantage over local EU firms.
title: Chinese Security Firm Nuctech Hit by EU Subsidy Probe

author: Allen K Wan, Nectar Gan
description: Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi will visit Saudi Arabia in the coming days on a trip to the Middle East, visiting a region vital to the energy needs of the world’s second-biggest economy.
title: China’s Top Diplomat to Visit Saudi Arabia on Middle East Trip

author: David Herbling
description: A Kenyan court temporarily froze the nation’s health deal with the US after a lobby group raised data-privacy concerns, even as President Donald Trump courts more African countries with similar pacts.
title: Kenya Court Halts $1.6 Billion Health Deal as US Courts Uganda

author: Jorge Valero, Alberto Nardelli
description: The European Union is pushing to reach an agreement as early as Friday to lengthen the bloc’s freeze on Russian assets using emergency powers — a key step toward tapping the funds to help Ukraine.
title: EU Seeks Russian Asset Freeze Deal by Friday to Ease Ukraine Aid

author: Ott Ummelas
description: Venezuelan dissident María Corina Machado said she plans to ultimately go back home and disappear from authorities to continue fighting for democracy.
title: Venezuela’s Machado Says She Will Go Back to Hiding After Nobel

author: Alexander Weber, Henrique Almeida, Oliver Crook
description: Portugal’s former central-bank Governor Mario Centeno is a potential contender to become the European Central Bank’s next vice president, according to the country’s finance minister.
title: Portugal Is Ready to Back Centeno for ECB Vice President Job

author: Aliaksandr Kudrytski
description: A coalition of Ukraine’s allies will discuss a bid to move swiftly on US President Donald Trump’s peace proposal on Thursday as Kyiv’s forces carried out their first-ever attack on Russian Caspian Sea oil production.
title: Ukrainian Allies to Meet as Kyiv Sends Draft Peace Plan to Trump

author: Michael Nienaber, Arne Delfs
description: German Chancellor Friedrich Merz’s ruling alliance set itself a deadline of the end of February for a final agreement on an overhaul of a controversial fossil-fuel heating law.
title: German Coalition Targets Accord on Disputed Heating Law by March

author: Sommer Saadi, Stephanie Flanders
description: On this episode of Trumponomics, we explain how a bluntly worded document that has foreign capitals up in arms was probably aimed at Trump’s base.
title: This National Security Strategy Wasn’t Written for Europe

description:
Bloomberg Daybreak Europe is your essential morning viewing to stay ahead. Live from London, we set the agenda for your day, catching you up with overnight markets news from the US and Asia.

On today's show, Oracle shares fell more than 10% in extended trading after the company reported a jump in AI spending on data centers and equipment. It follows fiscal second-quarter earnings which fell short of analysts' estimates.

The Fed delivered its third rate cut in a row, with policymakers maintaining their outlook for just one cut next year. Fed Chair Powell voiced optimism that the US economy will strengthen, as the inflationary impact from tariffs fades away.

Meanwhile, US forces intercepted and seized a sanctioned oil tanker off the coast of Venezuela, marking a serious escalation of tensions between the two countries.

Today's guests: Aneeka Gupta, Director of Macroeconomic Research at WisdomTree. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: US Seizes Tanker Near Venezuela, Oracle Disappoints & Fed Cuts | Daybreak Europe 12/11/2025

author: Bilal Hussain
description: The administration of US President Donald Trump has approved sales valued at $686 million of technology and equipment for Pakistan’s F-16 fighter jets to modernize its fleet.
title: US Signs Off on $686 Million Upgrade for Pakistan’s F-16 Jets

description: Ukraine sent a revised peace plan to Washington as President Donald Trump held a call with European leaders, according to a person familiar with the matter. This comes as both sides scramble to keep efforts on track to end Russia’s invasion. Weeks of talks have produced a document that’s more palatable to Kyiv, but several sticking points including over territory and security guarantees continue to stymie a deal. Bloomberg’s Oliver Crook reports.
title: Ukraine Sent Revised Peace Plan to Washington

author: Khine Lin Kyaw
description: Myanmar’s military regime carried out airstrikes on a public hospital in western Rakhine State late Wednesday, according to an opposition group, killing at least 33 people ahead of a tightly controlled national election.
title: Myanmar Opposition Says Junta Bombed Hospital, Killing 33 People

description: US forces intercepted and seized a sanctioned oil tanker off the coast of Venezuela. A senior Trump administration official referred to the ship as “a stateless vessel” that was last docked in Venezuela. The US action may make it much harder for Venezuela to export its crude, as other shippers are now likely to be more reluctant to load its cargoes. Bloomberg’s Stephen Stapczynski reports.
title: US Seizes Sanctioned Oil Tanker Off Coast of Venezuela

author: Anup Roy
description: India’s chief economic adviser said he would be surprised if an “elusive” trade deal with the US isn’t signed by March, as most trade-related issues have been resolved.
title: India’s Adviser Nageswaran Sees US Trade Deal Signed by March

author: Weilun Soon, Rong Wei Neo
description: The massive tanker seized by US forces off Venezuela has been part of the dark fleet for a number of years and was already well known by American authorities for its role in the Iranian oil trade.
title: Dark Fleet Oil Tanker Seized Off Venezuela Linked to Iran Trade

author: Nduka Orjinmo
description: Extremist groups competing for territory across West Africa could turn the region into a fluid insurgency corridor spanning roughly the distance from London to Rome and spark even more violence.
title: Islamist Militants Enter New Phase of Extremism in West Africa

author: Maciej Martewicz
description: Poland is speeding up its transition to clean energy, and that means pain for an industry whose traditions run deep through the nation.
title: Europe’s Coal Mining Holdout Braces for Its Inevitable Demise

author: Slav Okov
description: A wave of street protests against ruling class graft is destabilizing Bulgaria just weeks before the Balkan nation is set to join the euro.
title: Bulgarian Protests Throw Euro Area’s Next Member Into New Crisis

author: Josh Xiao
description: China conducted the maiden flight of what is considered to be the world’s largest drone mothership, underscoring its advances in unmanned aerial vehicles capable of unleashing weaponized swarms.
title: China Launches Massive Aerial Drone Carrier in Show of Prowess

author: Randy Thanthong-Knight, Patpicha Tanakasempipat
description: Casualties are mounting from the renewed border clash between Thailand and Cambodia as US President Donald Trump maintains a phone call he plans to make should quell the situation.
title: Thai-Cambodia Deaths Climb as Trump Says Phone Call Will Fix It

author: Yoshiaki Nohara
description: Japanese Defense Minister Shinjiro Koizumi conveyed “grave concerns” over rising security tensions involving China and Russia during video meetings with NATO’s chief and Italy’s defense minister, in a sign of Tokyo’s efforts to gain support from a broader international community.
title: Japan’s Defense Chief Conveys Concerns Over China to NATO Chief

author: Hannah Miller
description: The battle for Warner Bros. Discovery Inc. has already lit a fire in Hollywood, with unions decrying the potential job losses, theaters sounding an alarm about the future of film releases and actors worrying about free speech.
title: Warner Bros. Merger Fight Draws Fire Across US Political Divide

author: Gonzalo Soto
description: Mexican lawmakers gave final approval for new tariffs on Asian imports, broadly aligning with US efforts to tighten trade barriers against China, as President Claudia Sheinbaum seeks to protect local industry.
title: Mexico Approves Up to 50% Tariffs on China, Other Asian Nations

description: "Balance of Power: Late Edition" focuses on the intersection of politics and global business. On today's show, Betsey Stevenson, University of Michigan Public Policy & Economics Professor, reacts to President Trump suggesting US GDP should be as high as 25%. Wesley Clark, former NATO Supreme Allied Commander for Europe, discusses the United States seizing a Venezuelan oil tanker. Former Senator Pat Toomey (R-PA) talks about President Trump's affordability agenda event in Pennsylvania on Tuesday.  (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Trump Confirms US Seized Oil Tanker Off Venezuelan Coast | Balance of Power: Late Edition 12/10/2025

author: Irina Anghel
description: London is experiencing the most widespread declines in house prices in the UK, estate agents warned, as the capital bears the brunt of Labour’s new tax on high-value homes.
title: Tax Raid Deepens London’s Housing Market Downturn, Agents Say
